@iDecentralized Without the $LINK token, the Chainlink network would be incredibly crippled, there's many reason why Chainlink requires its own token  Doing an ICO provided the team with funding so they don't have to take fees, but thats just the tip of the iceberg

@ChainLinkGod @iDecentralized Yeah if LINK was replaced by ETH, then Chainlink and Ethereum will be competing for security.   Can't win vs Ethereum when it can literally print ETH for security.  LINK needs to be its own token to have self-soverign security from Ethereum.
#chainlink $link #bitcoin  Yesterday:  Chainlink Holders: 78,900  Today:  Chainlink Holders: 79,058  🚀

@iDecentralized Using $LINK also solves the chicken or egg problem of bootstrapping a new network as activity in the early days of the network can be subsidized when volume is low so it becomes economically feasible to participate in the network  35% of supply of $LINK is allocated for this  https://t.co/524SBIwJ9h

@iDecentralized Using $LINK means there's a single price for work done on any blockchain (even blockchains that don't have a native coin), this drastically reduces complexity as nodes only have to deal with a single token instead of different coins for different blockchains

@iDecentralized By forking the chainlink network, you would lose the security, network effects, data providers, node operators, and everything else that makes chainlink valuable/useful/secure  Works on theory, not in reality, we have seen this with the countless Bitcoin forka

@iDecentralized Another thing to note is that the $LINK token can be abstracted through the use of a DEX, meaning end users/contracts can indirectly pay in any currency (even fiat) as it will be exchanged for $LINK and then sent to the oracles  But $LINK is always being used in the background
One great thing about being in $LINK, over time you become a @ChainLink relaximalist.   Up, down, sideways short-term, doesn’t really matter in the end.   Stay comfy frens.  https://t.co/1sRwfkOron

@iDecentralized This would be great if Ethereum was the only platform @Chainlink was interested in serving.  However, being blockchain agnostic & serving contracts on all platforms has always been the stated goal.  You can't tie a global platform to the value of just one platform-specific asset.
